title: A 17-year-old celebrating her birthday with her parents was among the dozens who died in the diving boat fire off the coast of California
text:
A 17-year-old girl who was celebrating her birthday with her parents was among the dozens of people who died in a diving boat fire off the coast of California on Monday.

The Conception was carrying 33 passengers and six crew members when it caught fire off the coast of Santa Cruz island, just northwest of Los Angeles, early Monday morning. Rescue divers have found 25 bodies and nine people remain missing, according to Associated Press. The boat's captain and four crew members escaped the wreckage by jumping on to a dinghy.

Rescued crew members told the couple that saved them — Shirley Hansen and her husband Bob — that passengers on board the ship were celebrating birthdays for a 17-year-old girl and two other passengers hours before the fire broke out, according to the Los Angeles Times.

One crew member said the 17-year-old was on board with her parents and that the trip had been a birthday gift. No further information about the 17-year-old was immediately available.

Read more: Survivors of the Santa Cruz boat fire jumped ship and paddled to another vessel, banging on its hull until the owners woke up

Shirley Hansen told the LA Times that the crew members paddled to their nearby boat and banged on its hull until she and her husband woke up.

"It was horrific, the pounding," Shirley Hansen said. "Our boat is very well made. Having that sound come through [showed] they were very in need of help."

She said one of the crew members told her that his girlfriend was still inside the boat. She said two men went back to look for survivors but found none.

The fire broke out just before 3:30 a.m. on Sunday while the boat was anchored off Santa Cruz Island, about 90 miles northwest of Los Angeles.

By 7:20 a.m. the ship began to sink. Coast Guard Lt. Cmdr. Matthew Kroll told the Associated Press that the boat sank in about 60 feet of water, and several bodies have not been recovered due to unsafe conditions under the boat.
description: The Conception was carrying 33 passengers and six crew members when it caught fire off the coast of Southern California, early Monday morning.
